files.name: jan23rd1992
files.content: My co-worker Robert is a pain in the butt! Why does he always have to chew gum so loudly? It is so irritating working next to him.

files.name: jan26th1992
files.content: I can’t stand this anymore. He is so annoying. I need him to move to a different building.

files.name: jan27th1992
files.content: I’ve got an idea! If I can get into his computer somehow, I can delete some of his files to get him in trouble. But how do I get in? He always has his computer locked on a password… He probably based his password off something personal.

files.name: feb1st1992
files.content: Yesterday me and my other co-workers had a meeting, and Robert wouldn’t stop talking about some weird caesar cipher thing. I can’t stand that guy, he doesn’t even give others the chance to talk!

files.name: feb2nd1992
files.content: I figured out what Robert was talking about! After doing some research I found that the Caesar Cipher was actually used in ancient cryptography used by Gaius Caesar. It works by replacing each letter of the alphabet with another letter by shifting the whole alphabet a certain number of letters, which would wrap around to the beginning when you reach the end. So for example, if we shifted the alphabet 3 letters back the word HELLO would become EBIIL.
